meanings.definition: Make sensitive or aware to a particular stimulus or situation.
meanings.sent1: The training session sensitises employees to the importance of safety measures.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise sensitises the baby to sudden sounds.
meanings.sent3: The movie sensitises the audience to the struggles of the main character.
meanings.sent4: The touching story sensitises the heart to the beauty of human emotions.
meanings.sent5: The bitter experience sensitises us to the fragility of life.

meanings.definition: Cause to respond to certain stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The teacher sensitises students to the need for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent2: The medication sensitises the body to fight off infections.
meanings.sent3: The comedian sensitises the crowd to laughter with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The music sensitises the soul to the rhythm of life.
meanings.sent5: The aroma sensitises our taste buds to the delicious meal ahead.
